name: InterContinental Johannesburg OR Tambo Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As Airport hotels go this is as good as it gets. It is very conveniently located just across the street from the terminal, the staff will meet you at the exit to help you to the check-in and do the reverse on check-out and departure, the room is very clean, quiet and comfortable and OK size, the restaurant is very good for a hotel restaurant and the breakfast is very good.
reviews.title: Perfect for an Airport Stayover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: BA put us in this hotel after technical issue grounded us for 2 days. Couldn't fault it.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a terrifying aborted take-off, British Airways put us up in this hotel for 2 nights. Oh, it was JUST what I needed to calm my frazzled nerves before we finally flew home on a new plane BA flew out for us from London.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed...what can I say? I thought my bed at home (4-poster, vi-spring mattress, feather pillows) was the ultimate until I lay back on this...this... fluffy cloud of a bed! Turn down service, chocolate, slippers laid out. Marble-edged bathroom, wonderful shower with a massage setting, big bath tub. Sunny balcony. Nespresso machine, which thrilled my husband who loves his coffee.
reviews.title: VERY quiet and nicely appointed, but small room. Not cheap but VERY convienent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Nice hotel, we loved relaxing on the patio under the umbrellas. Breakfast was lovely - you must try the omlette with bacon and cheese!
reviews.title: Ultra-Convenient to JNB and The Gautrain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was suffering from a recent dislocated shoulder injury and due to being unable to obtain an earlier flight home stayed at the hotel for 3 days because of the close proximity to the Tambo Airport The staff were extremely helpful, caring and thoughful to relieve my anxiety so I would not feel embarrassed with my inability to do meanial tasks is to be commended These difficult tasks for me included eating in the dining room but also my personal care ,hygiene and dressing abilities not easy to do one handed There are two female staff members that I would highly praise for their outstanding support and concern Michelle Heck and another very special staff member named Refilwe both ladies didn't want any reward for their efforts but both are an asset to your beautiful hotel where the rooms,,food and service is excellent
reviews.title: Exceptional Staff Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a fairly typical Intercontinental in terms of its facilities etc. It is pricey, but one would expect that given its location and its target clientele.
reviews.title: Security

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: I do have a serious security isue with this hotel. The telephones in the rooms are cordless and ours didn't work (possibly flat batteries. OK, I went down from the eleventh floor and picked up new batteries). However, Johannesburg being Johannesburg, the question comes up if one didn't know the phone didn't work and there was a series of strange noises outside the room in the middle of the night or if there was a fire, how does one contact the desk. Again, Johannesburg being Jhannesburg, I'm not going to poke my head outside the door to investigate!!
reviews.title: Best place to rest between flights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ditch the cordless phones and replace them with hard wired ones. They may not be as glamourous but at least they work.
reviews.title: Four and a half star hotel at six star price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for only a few hours heading to Seychelles. The hotel is great, very calm and clean, just across the street from the airport. As I had 10 hours to wait the flight, I loved resting in an excellent bed and watch DVDs, just after a bubble bath.
reviews.title: Top hotel, but top price, too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great hotel, walking distance to Tambo Airport in Joburg, you literally just walk across the arrivals area and you're there! Very clean and the bathroom is awesome. Great coffee machine in each room! Concierge was very helpful in our duty free selection. You get what you pay for with this classy hotel.
reviews.title: 5 star accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Because of stop over from Amsterdam to Port Elizabeth I stayed in Intercontinental Tambo Airport. It was a very nice experience, but because of late arrival and early flight in the morning I only experienced my room. However, room was very comfortable. Because of my short stay costs per hour was quite high.
reviews.title: Too short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Will extend my stay during next vist.
reviews.title: Nice but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ole Sindberg
reviews.title: Best airport hotel I've ever stayed in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Lovely hotel - good rooms and bathrooms and good available eating areas with bar and swimming pool. Very expensive though.
reviews.title: Everything u expected from a five star hotel but service is 6 stars!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your plans call for a restful night in transit this is the spot. Very well located. Rooms extremely comfortable. Our first room had an unpleasant garage view so we asked for a higher level and better view and were accommodated. restaurant is good but pricey. There are quite a few less expensive food choices in the airport terminal.
reviews.title: Incredibly Convenient and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise. At first I was very apprehensive about staying at an "airport" hotel but quickly realized I had nothing to be worried about. The service was phenomonal and never heard ANY airplane noise at ALL. The concierge arranged for a couple of tours with a driver on very short notice. Hotel room was just lovely, and I loved having a Nepresso machine in our room. It was very easy to walk to the terminal and take the new Gautrain into Sandton and other areas. Beautiful way to get around Joburg! The staff was excellent. Only goof up was that we placed a breakfast the night before over the phone that evidently got lost but they quickly sent us up another order. The hotel has gone to great lenghts to make this not your typical airport hotel, excellent choice.
reviews.title: 2 day stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed for one night on a stopover between flights. The hotel is literally across the road from the terminal exit doors. No need for a taxi or shuttle. We had pre-booked and the check-in was very efficient.
reviews.title: Comforatble and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standard room was a good size and included an inroom safe and Wifi. Curtains provided excellent blackout and there was no airport noise. Very comfortable queen size bed, soft and soft pillows. The bathroom included a separate bath and shower (although tall people may find the bath a fraction on the shorter side).
reviews.title: Excellent airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we didn't eat that night, the Quills restaurant looked appealing. It had a South African influenced menu, with fish and vegetarian offerings, and a suitably extensive wine list incluing six or so 'by the glass' options. (I am not sure what other dining options are nearby, if any.)
reviews.title: Wonderfully Convenient

aka: Intercontinental Johannesburg Or Tambo Airport Hotel Kempton Park
description: InterContinental Johannesburg O.R. Tambo Airport is a safe and highly convenient hotel only 68.7 metres (225-foot) walk from the International Arrivals hall at Johannesburg's O.R. Tambo International Airport and is your ideal and hassle-free stopover for onward Southern African destinations, Game Reserves, Victoria Falls & Cape Town. Perfectly located for business and a 14-minute train ride from the Sandton CBD, the hotel facilities include free unlimited Wi-Fi, Business Centre, Health Spa, complimentary gym, swimming pool and DVD library. Guests love our large showers with massage showerheads and the ample natural light flowing from the floor to ceiling windows. In-room flight information allows you to time and plan your onward journeys from the comfort of your room. Soundproofed rooms, blackout curtains, king beds and fluffy duvets ensure you enjoy a great sleep experience. Quills Restaurant, open 24 hours daily, offers contemporary African dining, indoors or on the terrace. Winner of the 2011 Best Airport Hotel in Africa Award by Skytrax World Airport Awards and refurbished in 2008, the hotel offers the most sophisticated airport accommodations on the African Continent.
